==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=|rs=虫11}}

# [[spiral]]-shaped [[shellfish]]

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[ら]] (ra)
|kanon=[[ら]] (ra)
|kun=[[つび]] (tsubi), [[つぶ]] (tsubu), [[つみ]] (tsumi), [[にし]] (nishi), [[にな]] (nina)
}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ら}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ら}} {{m|zh|螺|tr=lwa||conch; spiral}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|ら|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ら}}

# any [[shellfish]] with a [[spiral]] [[shell]]

=====Usage notes=====
In compounds, may lend meanings of either {{m|en|shell}} or {{m|en|spiral}}.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|螺階|らかい}}: a [[spiral]] [[staircase]]
* {{ja-r|螺子|らし}}: a [[screw]] (more commonly read as ''neji'')
* {{ja-r|螺旋|らせん}}: a [[spiral]]
* {{ja-r|螺鈿|らでん}}: [[mother of pearl]]
* {{ja-r|螺杯|らはい}}, {{ja-r|螺盃|らはい}}: a [[drinking]] [[cup]] made from the [[shell]] of a {{taxlink|Turbo marmoratus|species|noshow=1}} or {{vern|green turban}} snail
* {{ja-r|螺髪|らほつ}}: one of the thirty-two different appearances of [[Buddha]], shown in [[statuary]] with a [[hairstyle]] consisting of [[knobby]] [[spiral]]s of [[hair]]
* {{ja-r|螺髻|らけい}}: a [[hairstyle]] with the hair wrapped up in a [[spiral]] [[bun]] similar in shape to a [[conch]] [[shell]]; a [[high]], [[verdant]] [[mountain]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|つび}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=つび}}. Cognate with {{m|ja|粒|tr=tsubu||grain; granule, little roundish bit of something}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> May have originally been the standalone form; compare {{m|ja|神|tr=kamu|pos=bound form, only used in compounds}} and {{m|ja|神|tr=kami|pos=standalone form}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|つび}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|つび}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=つび|obsolete}} [[spiral]] [[shellfish]], especially smaller ones
# {{lb|ja|sort=つび|obsolete}} alternate name for {{m|ja|蛤|tr=hamaguri||clam}}

===Etymology 3===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|ツブ|螺}}
{{wikipedia|Whelk}}
[[File:Whelks_at_a_fish_market_in_Japan.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|螺}} (''tsubu'', ''tsubi'', ''tsumi''): a variety of '''[[whelk]]s''' for sale.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|つぶ}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=つぶ}}. Cognate with {{m|ja|粒|tr=tsubu||grain; granule, little roundish bit of something}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> May have originally been the combining form; compare {{m|ja|神|tr=kamu|pos=bound form, only used in compounds}} and {{m|ja|神|tr=kami|pos=standalone form}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|つぶ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|つぶ}}

# [[spiral]] [[shellfish]], especially smaller ones
# [[edible]] [[marine]] [[whelk]]s of [[family]] [[Buccinidae]]
# alternate name for {{m|ja|田螺|tr=tanishi}}: [[river]] [[snail]]s of [[family]] ''{{taxlink|Viviparidae|family|noshow=1}}''

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|螺貝|つぶがい}}: [[whelk]]s and other [[spiral]] [[shellfish]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|つみ}}
{{IPAchar|/t͡subi/}} → {{IPAchar|/t͡sumi/}}

Shift in pronunciation from ''tsubi'' above.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|つみ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|つみ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=つみ|obsolete}} [[spiral]] [[shellfish]], especially smaller ones

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|にし}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=にし}}. Previously referred to any [[shellfish]] with a [[spiral]] [[shell]] (see ''ra'' above). Now refers more specifically to certain spiral shellfish. More common in compounds.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|にし|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|辛螺}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|にし}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=にし|rare}} certain [[shellfish]] with a [[spiral]] [[shell]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|螺肴|にしざかな}}: a [[side dish]] served at [[New Years]] [[celebration]]s, made from [[boiled]] or [[stewed]] {{m|ja|田螺|tr=tanishi||[[river]] [[snail]]s of [[family]] ''{{taxlink|Viviparidae|family|noshow=1}}''}}
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-r|赤螺|あかにし}}: {{taxlink|Rapana venosa|species|noshow=1}}, the {{vern|veined rapa whelk}}
* {{ja-r|田螺|たにし}}: [[river]] [[snail]]s of [[family]] ''{{taxlink|Viviparidae|family|noshow=1}}''
* {{ja-r|長螺|ながにし}}: {{vern|tulip snail}}s or {{vern|spindle snail}}s, [[marine]] [[snail]]s of [[family]] ''{{taxlink|Fasciolariidae|family|noshow=1}}''
* {{ja-r|丸田螺|まるたにし}}: {{taxlink|Bellamya chinensis|species|noshow=1}} or {{taxlink|Cipangopaludina chinensis|species|noshow=1}}, the {{vern|Chinese mystery snail}}, {{vern|black snail}}, or {{vern|trapdoor snail}}
{{der-bottom}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|螺|にな}} (see below), {{ja-r|蜷|にな}}, {{ja-r|河貝子|にな}}

===Etymology 6===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|にな}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=にな}}.

Less common spelling in modern {{etyl|ja|-}}. When written in kanji, more commonly spelled {{m|ja|蜷}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|にな|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|蜷}}, {{ja-l|蝸螺}}, {{ja-l|河貝子}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|にな}}

# [[shellfish]] with a [[spiral]] [[shell]]
# {{abbreviation of|lang=ja|sort=にな|川蜷}} (''kawanina''): {{taxlink|Semisulcospira libertina|species|noshow=1}}, a kind of [[freshwater]] [[snail]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|磯蜷|いそにな}}: a small [[edible]] [[marine]] [[snail]] of [[family]] [[Buccinidae]]
* {{ja-r|海蜷|うみにな}}: {{taxlink|Batillaria multiformis|species|noshow=1}}, a small [[edible]] [[marine]] [[snail]]
* {{ja-r|川蜷|かわにな}}: {{taxlink|Semisulcospira libertina|species|noshow=1}}, a kind of [[freshwater]] [[snail]]
{{der-bottom}}
